channel.title: Client Configurations [377]

item.title: Client Configurations [377]
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

BorigTheDwarf:

And although this may sound stupid, what is a widget?

Widgets are interface components (wiki). In the RuneScape client, some widgets store text, others hold images or models, and some are containers for other widgets.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Configurations [377]
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

wscripts.txt is a list of conditions sets active/inactive widget features if all the parameters in the script.

winfo.txt is just widget information such as active/inactive text, the type it is etc

Read full topic

item.title: Client Configurations [377]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

I think you are going to have to give some kind of explanation please

EDIT:
Upon closer inspection I think I understand. Those are all the client configs which have conditions, checked clientside, before the configuration will work. Do you have a list of all the client configs and their valid IDs as well? I will check some of the ones you posted now.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Configurations [377]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

Hello, I am hoping to make a definitive list of all of the client configurations which can be changed (Like buttons going red, prayers lighting up, tracks being changed from red to green, quests being made from red to green).

Here are some I found on Rune-Pooper

IDS for changing frame 36, - By gander 171 : chat effects on/off 170 : MouseButtons one/two 287 : SPLIT PRIVATE CHAT ON/OFF 427 : ACCEPT AID YES/NO 166 : BRIGHTNESS --- prayers --- 83: THICK SKIN 84 BURST OF STRENGTH 85: CLARITY OF THOUGHT 86: ROCK SKIN 87: SUPERHUMAN STRENGTH 88: IMPROVED REFLEXES 89 RAPID RESTORE 90: RAPID HEAL 91: PROTECT ITEMS 92 STEAL SKIN 93: ULTIMATE STRENGTH 94: INCREDABLE REFLEXES 95: PROTECT FROM MAGIC 96: PROTECT FROM RANGE 97: PROTECT FROM MELE 98: RETRIBUTION 99: RENDEMPTION 100: SMITE 172: ON OFF INFORMATION SCREEN -- player controls WALK/RUN : 173

And I have also done these myself:

setClientConfig(18,1); //Switches between man and auto on music tab 1 = auto 0 = man setClientConfig(19,0);//Switches loop on and off in music tab on = 1 setClientConfig(20, 0); //Activates Adventure (Song) setClientConfig(25,0); //Activates Shining (Song) setClientConfig(43,0); //Weapon Menu (AttackType) First option = 0 etc

Here is a full list of those taken from a winterlove server that I have been working through:

setClientConfig(44,0); //No idea setClientConfig(75,0);//No idea setClientConfig(101,0);//No idea setClientConfig(104,0);//No idea setClientConfig(106,0);//No idea setClientConfig(108,0);//No idea setClientConfig(115,0);//No idea setClientConfig(143,0);//No idea setClientConfig(153,0);//No idea setClientConfig(156,0);//No Idea setClientConfig(157,0);//No idea setClientConfig(158,0);//No idea setClientConfig(166,0); setClientConfig(167,0); setClientConfig(168,0); setClientConfig(169,0); setClientConfig(170,0); setClientConfig(171,0); setClientConfig(172,0); setClientConfig(173,0); setClientConfig(174,0); setClientConfig(203,0); setClientConfig(210,0); setClientConfig(211,0); setClientConfig(261,0); setClientConfig(262,0); setClientConfig(263,0); setClientConfig(264,0); setClientConfig(265,0); setClientConfig(266,0); setClientConfig(268,0); setClientConfig(269,0); setClientConfig(270,0); setClientConfig(271,0); setClientConfig(280,0); setClientConfig(286,0); setClientConfig(287,0); setClientConfig(297,0); setClientConfig(298,0); setClientConfig(301,01); setClientConfig(304,01); setClientConfig(309,01); setClientConfig(311,01); setClientConfig(312,01); setClientConfig(313,01); setClientConfig(330,01); setClientConfig(331,01); setClientConfig(342,01); setClientConfig(343,01); setClientConfig(344,01); setClientConfig(345,01); setClientConfig(346,01); setClientConfig(353,01); setClientConfig(354,01); setClientConfig(355,01); setClientConfig(356,01); setClientConfig(361,01); setClientConfig(362,01); setClientConfig(363,01); setClientConfig(377,01); setClientConfig(378,01); setClientConfig(379,01); setClientConfig(380,01); setClientConfig(383,01); setClientConfig(388,01); setClientConfig(391,01); setClientConfig(393,01); setClientConfig(399,01); setClientConfig(400,01); setClientConfig(406,01); setClientConfig(408,01); setClientConfig(414,01); setClientConfig(417,01); setClientConfig(423,01); setClientConfig(425,01); setClientConfig(427,01); setClientConfig(433,01); setClientConfig(435,01); setClientConfig(436,01); setClientConfig(437,01); setClientConfig(439,01); setClientConfig(440,01); setClientConfig(441,01); setClientConfig(442,01); setClientConfig(443,01); setClientConfig(445,01); setClientConfig(446,01); setClientConfig(449,01); setClientConfig(452,01); setClientConfig(453,01); setClientConfig(455,01); setClientConfig(464,01); setClientConfig(465,01); setClientConfig(470,01); setClientConfig(482,01); setClientConfig(486,01); setClientConfig(491,01); setClientConfig(492,01); setClientConfig(493,01); setClientConfig(496,01); setClientConfig(497,01); setClientConfig(498,01); setClientConfig(499,01); setClientConfig(502,01); setClientConfig(503,01); setClientConfig(504,01); setClientConfig(505,01); setClientConfig(506,01); setClientConfig(507,01); setClientConfig(508,01); setClientConfig(509,01); setClientConfig(510,01); setClientConfig(511,01); setClientConfig(512,01); setClientConfig(515,01); setClientConfig(518,01); setClientConfig(520,01); setClientConfig(521,01); setClientConfig(524,01); setClientConfig(525,01); setClientConfig(531,01);

I suspect though that any number from 0 - Whatever is the max in the client will change something.

Thank you for your help, I am sure this list will benefit the community as a whole. (Just for 1 thing it will mean instead of changing the text everytime in the quest menu people will just be able to send the correction configuration)

Read full topic
